p: Only alpha and beta coronaviruses are known to infect humans. Both HCoVs 229E and NL63 are alpha coronaviruses and HCoV-HKU1, HCoV-OC43, MERS-CoV, and SARS-CoV are beta coronaviruses ( Table 1) [ 24, 25]. Phylogenetic analysis has revealed that SARS-CoV-2 also falls within the beta coronavirus in the same subgenus as the SARS-CoV, but in a different clade [ 26]. All 7 coronaviruses that infect humans are believed to have originated in bats [ 27, 28]. Based on modeling, it is speculated that HCoV-OC43 was transmitted to humans around 1890 [ 29]. Bats also appear to be the original host of SARS-CoV-2, and it is hypothesized that currently unknown wild animal(s) sold at the Huanan seafood market in Wuhan, China, might have played a role as an intermediate host to humans [ 26].
